main.name: Ryan Campisi
main.bio: I am a 23 year old recent graduate from the University of Florida. I have a passion for education and technology and aim to contribute to the field of computer science in a meaningful way.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to contact me for any questions or concerns.

technologies.name: Kotlin
technologies.about: Kotlin is a modern, statically typed programming language that is fully interoperable with Java and is used for Android development, server-side development, and more.

projects.title: Memory Maker for Pet Lovers
projects.description: An Android app for pet owners to save, favorite, and share photo memories with their pets. Features include RecyclerView, fragments, SQLite storage, photo capture, and sharing via intents. Users can filter, edit, and delete memories, with a clean, multi-activity UI.

projects.title: Who Wants to Be a Thousandaire?
projects.description: An Android trivia game app inspired by 'Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?' featuring multiple activities, explicit intents, and a multi-screen flow. Players answer six multiple-choice questions, can quit or continue after each, and see their score at the end. Built with good Android practices and model classes.

projects.title: Adventure Game
projects.description: A text-based Android adventure game built in Kotlin. Features room navigation, a tavern with unique logic, player inventory, lootable rooms, and monster battles. Enhanced with object-oriented design, data classes, and custom commands for looting, inventory, and tavern interaction.

work.title: Software Developer
work.description: Facilitating the development and management of courseware for the United States Navy.

work.title: Expert AI Data Trainer
work.description: Collaborating closely with a team of fellow expert trainers, AI developers, and researchers, actively influencing the ongoing development of the AI model itself. Providing insights, feedback, and expertise that directly contributed to the evolution of the AI, making the role intellectually stimulating and instrumental in pushing the boundaries of AI technology.

work.title: Mathematics Tutor
work.description: Responsible for conducting private appointment tutoring for various math courses, including Calculus, Linear Algebra, and Differential Equations. I also led weekly Calculus review sessions for NROTC students.

work.company: UF Herbert Wertheim College of Engineering
work.title: Research Assistant
work.description: Assisted the Machine Learning & Sensing Lab on a project involving underwater hydrophones to research and understand coral reef ecosystems from an acoustics perspective.

work.title: Math Success Leader / Peer Coach
work.description: Responsible for leading weekly class sessions for Calculus students, grading Calculus papers, and conducting private appointment advising for STEM students looking to be successful in their transition to UWF.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Ryan Campisi must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
